newsitem.title: USA: Freddie Mac injects $704 mln into three REMICs.
newsitem.headline: Freddie Mac injects $704 mln into three REMICs.

text.p: The Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (FHLMC) said it increased the collateral of three previously issued Real Estate Mortgage Investment Conduit (REMIC) Securities.
REMIC 1926, underwritten by Bear Stearns Cos Inc, has been increased to $487.5 million from $325 million, Freddie Mac said. The issue is backed by collateral series C31, FHLMC said.

REMIC 1927, underwritten by Bear Stearns Cos Inc, has been increased by a total of $245 million, the agency said. The issue is backed by about $465 million of 30-year 7.5 percent single family fixed rate mortgages and $285 million of 30-year 6.5 percent single family fixed rate mortgages, said Freddie Mac.

REMIC 1921, underwritten by Lehman Bros Holding Inc, has been increased to $496.5 million from $200 million, FHLMC said. The issue is backed by about $356.5 million of 30-year 6.5 percent single family fixed rate mortgages and $140 million of 30-year 7.5 percent paper, Freddie Mac said.
